A-B Orrefors Glasbruk 3’3-44, konstnärl. ledare där. Utf. arb. i g<las o. porshn, måln. i olja o. akvarell, träsnitt. Repr. i Nat :mus.. Metropol. Mus., Nev^ York, o. de fl. större mus. i Europa. Ordf. i Sv:es småglasbruks-förb., i Sv. hushållsglasfabr. fören. 36-44, styr :supp’l. i Sv. arb :giv :fören. 36 -44. Stud: res. utom ovannämnda t. Frankr. o. translated: Hald, Niels Tove Edward, artist, former director, Orrefors, born on September 17th, 1883 in Stockholm to merchant Ditlef H. and Jemima Swanilund. Married first in December 1912 to Brita Lagerström, who died in 1931, and second in 1932 to Birgitta Tenger. Children: Elisa (born) 1913, Arthur (born) 1916, Mary-Ann (born) 1921, Niels-Christian (born) 1933. Education: Graduated from Stockholm Art School in 1903, studied in Germany and England from 1903-1905, was a student of Rodhe in Copenhagen in 1907, attended the School of Arts and Crafts in Gothenburg in 1908, studied in Paris from 1908-1909, and Italy in 1912. Work: Artist at Orrefors Glassworks from 1917 to 1924, served as artistic director of Karlskrona Porcelain Factory from 1924 to 1933, and was the managing director of AB Orrefors Glassworks from 1933 to 1944. Created works in glass and porcelain, painted in oil and watercolor, and made woodcuts. His works are represented in the National Museum, the Metropolitan Museum, and other major museums in Europe and the United States. Hald served as chairman of the Swedish small glassworks association and the Swedish household glass factory association from 1936-1944 and was a board member of the Swedish Employers' Association from 1936-1944. He traveled to France and England in 1920, Italy in 1924, Spain in 1925, and the United States in 1928 and 1935. Awarded the Grand Prix in Paris in 1925, was an honorary member of the Royal Society of Art, received the Order of the Polar Star, was a Knight of the Order of Vasa, Officer of the French Legion of Honour, Knight of the Royal Order of Orange-Nassau, and received the Prince Eugen Medal in 1945.
